isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - PRINCIPLES, OPERATION AND SERVICE - OPERATION - TRACTION CONTROL WHEN VEHICLE SPEED IS ABOVE 25 MPH

svcproc.title: TRACTION CONTROL WHEN VEHICLE SPEED IS ABOVE 25 MPH
svcproc.para: If wheel spin occurs at any speed above 25 MPH, the controller does the following:

step1.para: The controller will instantly blink the Traction Active light on the instrument panel to advise the driver that wheel spin is occurring.
The controller uses its J1922 Data Link connection to the engine electronic control module (ECM) to send a signal causing the ECM to reduce engine torque to a suitable level.
The controller does not send a signal to the modulators to apply service brakes (even slightly) at any speed above 25 mph.
Once the wheel spin is eliminated, the controller turns the Traction Active light OFF, and releases system control.
